messages.message:
Since I have started calling the AI Hub Converse APIs, I get these conversations visible in the UI that I am not able to delete. I am also not able to list or delete these via the API, so these are sat there clogging up my converse UI.
1. Is it possible to make these visible, and deleteable within the UI?
2. Why are those not visible or deletable via the API?
These are in the account: <mailto:tom.deaney+aihubPROD@instabase.com|tom.deaney+aihubPROD@instabase.com>

cc @Balaram if delete has not been implemented please prioritize

@Tom Deaney -- may I ask about your use case for converse API?
@Kerry Delete APIs are supported from 23.41 release.  I will work with Tom to understand this issue.

@Tom Deaney Currently conversations created from UI are not compatible with the conversations from the API.

`Conversations created with APIs and those created in the AI Hub user interface (UI) are incompatible. Interact with API-created conversations only by using the API. Similarly, don't use APIs to interact with conversations created in the UI.`
https://aihub.instabase.com/docs/aihub/apis/converse-api/index.html

• Is it possible to make these visible, and deleteable within the UI?
*Balaram:* We are working on to migrate the converse app to use the Converse APIs (using DB for document management). This will make the end user experience much better. I will share the timeline here.

• Why are those not visible or deletable via the API?
*Balaram:* Regarding delete, I will connect with you to understand how these conversations are visible in UI and help with deleting the conversations.
